newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Over 20,000 S.African felons have guns--minister.
newsitem.headline: Over 20,000 S.African felons have guns--minister.

text.p: Over 20,000 South Africans with serious previous criminal convictions had firearm licences, police minister Sydney Mufamadi said on Thursday.

"The system of checking for previous convictions through the criminal record centre is inadequate and incapable of providing accurate information," Mufamadi said in a statement explaining why the licences had been issued.

"Steps have already been taken to rectify this problem," he said, adding a task force was liaising with other offices to correct mistaken or duplicate identity numbers on the Population Register and facilitate consultation among state departments.

In an effort to control the proliferation of guns in the crime-afflicted country, Mufamadi last year appointed a four-person committee of inquiry to investigate administrative problems and irregularities at the Central Firearms Registry.
The committee identified management problems and labelled the system for controlling gun licensing as "seriously flawed".
The committee also found that over 12,000 people had 10 or more licensed firearms, while 62 of those had between 50 and a whopping 648 firearms in their private collections, the minister said.
Last year 195,639 licences were approved in South Africa while nearly 14,000 applications were refused.
